Posts.Content: Hi I feel the same and need a bit more info to convince me that it is safe and worthwhile taking, I'll speak to my oncologist and bcn..........wary of taking anything that might conflict with my medications but want a recommendation for a good multivitamin.  Just diagnosed with osteoporosis last month to add to my woes!  All the best
Posts.Title: herbal remedies

Posts.Content: Hi I know this is an old post but I am in the same position as you taking letrozole ad- cal-d and alendronic acid for osteoporosis and looking for info on epo (I'm 53).  I asked the pharmacy about my nails and she recommended epo and mentioned something about hormones which I didn't quite catch so unsure whether to go ahead with them.  Nobody has recommended supplements and I only take cod liver oil as recommended by my optician.  So much conflicting information about  phytoestrogens.
Posts.Title: herbal remedies

Posts.Content: Hi i was treated for breast cancer at Forth Valley last year and the 2 female oncologists then, were Dr's Rabanawar and Fraser. It' a relatively new hospital, big bright and airy but  well signposted.  All the staff I encountered were lovely and very supportive, I was treated well and had no complaints.......can't think of anything else to say but please ask if I can help.  All the best to you and your mum x
Posts.Title: forth valley hospital larbert

Posts.Content: Hi Thank you both for your support and making me smile and wishing Jackie all the best.  Trying to distract myself and not get too uptight, will keep you posted.......
Posts.Title: Year on mammogram coming up

Posts.Content: That's great news, so glad it went well for you, and thanks for your words of inspiration
Posts.Title: Year on mammogram coming up

Posts.Content: Thank you sister snail and weeaw will certainly mention my experience
Posts.Title: Year on mammogram coming up

Posts.Content: Hello all, my consultation and first mammogram is due next week.  When I was first diagnosed they had to repeat it several times, it was very painful and distressing and all the memories are flooding back, just as I was beginning to feel myself again.  I also get the odd twinge and a bit of discomfort under my breast from time to time and wondered if this is normal.  Do they give the results on the same day as was the case when I was diagnosed, if not how long do you have to wait for the results?.......can't stop thinking about it.  This site has got me through a tough year, thanks to everyone
Posts.Title: Year on mammogram coming up

Posts.Content: Good news......Finally got my results after a 3 week wait and all is clear!......such a relief. The mammogram went ok, knowing what to expect helps
Posts.Title: Year on mammogram coming up

Posts.Content: I lost all mine gradually, finished chemo at the end of November and had a full set of new talons by the end of April, it takes time but reaching these little milestones feels so good.  I wrapped a bit of micro pore round mine when they came off and felt a bit tender
Posts.Title: lost a nail

Posts.Content: Don't know about helping them grow, but it might stop them cracking and splitting, my daughter gave me an almond oil cuticle pen from the body shop and nu- nale was recommended to me which worked well
Posts.Title: lost a nail
